solution: The area of the square is $6^{2}=36$ square centimeters. The area of the four quarter-circles with radius 3 is equivalent to the area of one circle with radius 3, or $\pi\cdot3^{2}=9\pi.$ So, the area of the shaded region is $36-9\pi.$ Thus, $a=36$ and $b=9,$ so $a+b=\boxed{45}.$
model_solution:
The area of the entire square is $6^2=36$ square units.
The area of each of the four quarter-circles is $\frac14\pi3^2=\frac94\pi$ square units.
The shaded area is the area of the square minus the area of the four quarter-circles, which is $36-4\cdot\frac94\pi$.
$36-4\cdot\frac94\pi=36-12\pi$
Substitute $a=36$ and $b=12$ into $a+b$ to get $36+12=48$.
Substitute $a=36$ and $b=12$ into $a+b$ to get $36+12=48$.
steps: The area of the entire square is $6^2=36$ square units.
The area of each of the four quarter-circles is $\frac14\pi3^2=\frac94\pi$ square units.
The shaded area is the area of the square minus the area of the four quarter-circles, which is $36-4\cdot\frac94\pi$.
full_steps: The area of the entire square is $6^2=36$ square units.
The area of each of the four quarter-circles is $\frac14\pi3^2=\frac94\pi$ square units.
The shaded area is the area of the square minus the area of the four quarter-circles, which is $36-4\cdot\frac94\pi$.
